alert.note: Alert for Jewell; Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued March 17 at 3:30PM CDT until March 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 9 PM THIS EVENING TO 7 AM CDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Wet snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches. North winds gusting 35 to 40 mph. * WHERE...Smith, Jewell and Phillips Counties. * WHEN...From 9 PM this evening to 7 AM CDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain is forecast to change to snow after sunset, and become heavy, at times, overnight. Despite temperatures mainly above freezing, peak snow rates near 1 inch per hour are possible, and would be enough to overwhelm relatively warm surface temperatures. Strong, gusty north winds are likely, so areas that do see snow will have significantly reduced visibilities to near-blizzard conditions during the heaviest snow. Snow will mostly end by dawn Friday morning, but lingering effects could impact the morning commute. Elevated and grassy surfaces, along with bridges, will see the highest snowfall accumulations.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
